org.springframework.data.gemfire

Class RegionShortcutConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.data.gemfire.RegionShortcutConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.core.convert.converter.Converter<java.lang.String,org.apache.geode.cache.RegionShortcut>

    public class RegionShortcutConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.core.convert.converter.Converter<java.lang.String,org.apache.geode.cache.RegionShortcut>
    The RegionShortcutConverter class is a Spring Converter implementation converting String value Region Shortcut representations into actual GemFire RegionShortcut enumerated values.
    Since:
    1.3.4
    See Also:
    Converter, RegionShortcut

    • Method Detail

      • toUpperCase

        protected static java.lang.String toUpperCase(java.lang.String value)
        Converts the String value to upper case, trimming all whitespace. This method guards against null values and returns the "null" String if value is null.
        Parameters:
        value - the String to convert to a trimmed, upper case value.
        Returns:
        a trimmed, upper case value of the specified String, or "null" if the String value reference is null.
        See Also:
        String.toUpperCase(), String.trim(), String.valueOf(Object)

      • convert

        public org.apache.geode.cache.RegionShortcut convert(java.lang.String source)
        Converts the source String representation of a Region Shortcut into a RegionShortcut enumerated value.
        Specified by:
        convert in interface org.springframework.core.convert.converter.Converter<java.lang.String,org.apache.geode.cache.RegionShortcut>
        Parameters:
        source - the String representation of the Region Shortcut to convert.
        Returns:
        a RegionShortcut enumerated value for the String representation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String source is not a valid RegionShortcut enumerated value.
        See Also:
        RegionShortcut.valueOf(String)
